description: The gene identifier, consisting of the the first word of the original FASTA sequence header followed by an underscore followed by the ordinal ID of the protein
The amino acid sequence of the geneâ€™s coding region
The GTDB accession of the genome to which the gene belongs
The location of the start of the gene in the genome
The location of the end of the gene in the genome
The GC content of the gene
Whether or not the gene is read from the reverse strand
TThe sequence of the start codon (usually ATG, GTG, or TTG). If the gene has no start codon, this field will be labeled Edge
The RBS binding motif detected by Prodigal
The RBS spacer detected by Prodigal
An identifier for each gene consisting of the ordinal ID of the sequence and an ordinal ID of that gene within the sequence (separated by an underscore)

An indicator of if a gene runs off the edge of a sequence or into a gap. 0 indicates the gene has a true boundary, whereas a 1 indicates the gene is incomplete at that edge, e.g. 01 means a gene is partial at the right boundary, 11 indicates both edges are incomplete, 00 indicates a complete gene with a start and stop codon
